pipeline_name.description: A name for this pipeline; the name is used to namespace various objects used internally for the pipeline execution, such as the database collection name.

remote_box_definition.description: Configuration of remote inbox or outbox

kind.description: The type of Remote Box being configured.

tapis_box_definition.description: A pipeline box defined using a Tapis system and path.

system_id.description: The id of the Tapis system to use for the box definition.

path.description: Path on the Tapis system to use for the box definition.

globus_box_definition.description: A pipeline box defined using a Globus endpoint.

client_id.description: The id of the Globus client to use when issuing transfers.

endpoint_name.description: The name of the Globus endpoint.

directory.description: The directory within the Globus endpoint to use for the box definition.

pipeline_job_definition.description: Description of the pipeline job to run on new input files.

tapis_app_job.description: A Pipeline job described using a Tapis app

app_id.description: The app id to use when submitting the job,

manifest_input_name.description: The name of the input on the Tapis app for the manifest file.

raw_files_input_name.description: The name of the input on the Tapis app to be used for sending the raw input files. If empty, no input name will be specified.

tapis_actor_job.description: A Pipeline job described using a Tapis actor

actor_id.description: The id of the actor. The Tapis Pipelines software will send a JSON message to the actor with details about the job (see documentation).

local_script_job.description: A Pipeline job described using a local script

base_url.description: The base URL for the Tapis tenant to interact with.

username.description: The Tapis username to use when accessing Tapis services.

password.description: The password associated with the Tapis username. Using an access_token is preferred.

access_token.description: An access token associated with the Tapis username. If no token is provided, the pipelines software look in the environment for an access token. First looks for a variable named TAPIS_PIPELINES_ACCESS_TOKEN and then for _abaco_access_token in case the pipelines software is running as an Abaco actor.

meta_db.description: The database to use when writing to the Meta API. If not provided, Tapis Pipelines will attempt to use a default, but providing the value explicitly is strongly encouraged. The tapis username provided in this config must have write access to this db.

meta_collection.description: The collection to use when writing to the Meta API. Each pipeline should write to its own collection. If not provided, Tapis Pipelines will attempt to use <username>.<pipeline_name>, but providing the value explicitly is strongly encouraged.
